text:
Ezra Matthew Miller (30, September 1992) is an American actor of Jewish descent. He played Patrick in the 2012 movie "The Perks of Being a Wallflower". For the role he won the Boston Society of Film Critics Award for Best Supporting Actor. He will play Leon in the 2014 movie "Madame Bovary". He has said that he is queer. He comes from the great state of New Jersey once quoting that he loved his hometown very much. As a proud New Jerseyan, he re-visits his hometown at least once a month and hates anyone who discriminates or set horrible stereotypes on his hometown and nationality. He once quoted in a very new New Jerseyan accent, "If I really was a wizard, I'd teleport to New Jersey; If I really was the flash, I'd run to New Jersey; Basically, I love New Jersey. I'd go back everyday just to get a taste of those pork chops."
He appeared in the 2016 movie ' as The Flash. He played the role again on "Suicide Squad" and the 2017 movie "Justice League".
He portrayed Credence Barebone in the 2016 movie "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them".
